data.client_name: Reproduce a few wordpress pages in DIVI
data.note:
Hi, if you know Wordpress and DIVI, this will be easy for you.


We have this old theme which has a LOT of problems with it regarding speed and such. We wish to reproduce it in DIVI to make sure it's speedy and uptodate and get rid of the previous theme but of course, we want to make sure it looks very similar (not exact, just similar).


We need you to redo a few pages with the DIVI theme so they look as similar as possible to how they are now.


* we already have DIVI

* You will have to do this on your scratch server so we can see what it looks like before we replace it.

* Basically you will only have to reproduce a few pages like home, about us, contact, services, and so on. All the posts will update to the new template.

* Then all you would do is export the pages via wordpress export and we will import them.

* You are only responsible for the LOOK of the site being similar not the backend.


Should take around 3-4 hours.


*** as an antispam test, please use the phrase "DIVI reproduce" in your bid/reply so we know you aren't just a robot or spamming. Thanks


That's it! Thanks for the interest
data.cover_letter: "DIVI reproduce" Hi, I am a WordPress web developer and Divi Expert with 8 years experience. Please knock me in chat with site details to discuss more.

data.client_name: Improve the Aesthetic and Design of 5 Wordpress Sites
data.note:
Reposting a job I posted earlier with more clarification.


I operate 5 content wordpress sites. All use the GeneratePress theme and i want to keep it that way. I need someone who can provide and implement design improvements so the sites look more professional and impressive. I will give you some sites to generally model the ideas after, but I really want your input on what you recommend too. This is not simply executing a checklist.


The winning candidate will:

1. Be able to provide design and aesthetic improvements to the first site, as we agree on the look and feel that we want

2. Then apply the look and feel to the other 4 sites

3. Have a good design eye

4. Be able to implement the design changes in Wordpress GeneratePress (I will give you WP-Admin access)

5. Have an understanding of the plugins required to accomplish the design improvements

6. Be aware of how design improvements may impact SEO or site speed

7. Be able to show a portfolio of previous projects where they have configured and implemented improved Wordpress designs


I would like the first site done in a week. I would like the following sites done in the following week. 2 weeks total.


YOUR PRICE NEEDS TO REFLECT THE FIXED, ALL-IN PRICE FOR COMPLETION FO THE 5 SIMILAR SITES!


I want a who can make my site look more professional and flow better. I actually have 5 sites, and I would like them all to use the same look and feel.... and all Using the GeneratePress theme as its base.


To be considered for this job, you must have a portfolio of wordpress sites that you have made look really good.

data.note:
I'm looking for someone to redesign and manage my existing website and blog, including:



1. Moving the site to a different WordPress theme (maybe Wild Book, but I'm open to others).


2. Completing installation of an email platform (MailPoet, similar to MailChimp). I send out

links to a new blog post each Monday and a zoom link on Thursday for Fridays at 4 (eastern

time) discussions.


3. Connecting the page to a few social media sites (facebook, substack, maybe a couple of

others). My page is about reading poetry, and I'm interested in reaching only a small, targeted

audience.


4. Maybe adding a payment opetion. My site is currently noncommercial, but I'm consider

charging for it sometime in the future, in which case I would need payment options added.


5. Managing the site long-term. I can't do it, not even if you try to explain it to me. What you

will say is Sanskrit to me.


6. I need someone with mad skills (since mine don't go beyond basic) for all the tech stuff.

The right person will speak Mac as a first language, have experience with setting up email

platforms, and experience with WordPress.


7. Social skills. I'm extremely picky. (If you've heard of Fran Lebowitz, think of her--if not, you

might want to look her up). I've worked as an editor, proofreader, and book designer,

and details really matter to me. At the same time, I don't know what has to happen on the

tech end to make them appear on the website, so I need someone with a lot of patience.


8. A background in poetry, literature, or other arts would definitely put you high on my list.

The website is sharonbryanpoet.com

We have some plugins that may be redundant when you redesign and we are okay disabling/removing for the final release.


Site: bitlounger.com


This is built in Wordpress using WooCommerce as the backend. We would like to keep this as a WooCommerce store.


Retain existing functionality:

WooCommerce

Newsletter signup (Mailchimp)

Chatbot (Tidio)


Important:


1. Branding

1. We have a logo and primary color we like, however, we are open to a new style guide. This includes: secondary/tertiary colors, button design/states, font, etc.

2. Homepage

1. Users shop for items in one of two ways, either by System or by Product. It likely makes sense to highlight these on the home page.

2. Mobile friendly - currently, the home page does a terrible job when viewed on mobile. It is responsive, however, it’s hard to navigate to specific categories of items.

3. On the homepage we would like to draw attention to becoming an affiliate for our brand. This should not be high on the page, but more prominent than just in the global navigation.

4. We would like our affiliate application (currently on an external Typeform link) hosted within the site using a contact form instead of sending the user to the Typeform link.

3. Category Pages

1. Redesign the category pages (ex: https://bitlounger.com/product-category/products/cartvault/)

4. Item Pages

1. Redesign the item pages to emphasize the images/video

2. Make social sharing available, but less dominant on the page

3. We need to make it very clear when items are in “Backorder” status


The only additional features that are not currently on our site that we would like are:

1. Ability to add tracking number to an order and the customer be able to track from their account. Currently, we enter in the tracking number as a note to the customer, but there is no way for the customer to track without copy/pasting the tracking number elsewhere to track.




Navigation / Global Primary:


Homepage

About

My Account (WooCommerce)

Become Affiliate

Contact


Navigation / Footer:


Quick Links

- Shop Home

- About

- Affiliates

- Contact


Shop (list categories here)


Account

- My Account

- Checkout


Subscribe (ability to register for newsletter)

We need support with optimizing performance for a wordpress site. Dashboard from Blog Vault (see attached) indicates issues with e.g. unused java script.


Activities:

- Analyze the performance of a WordPress website using the tool Blog Vault and potentially other relevant performance analysis tools.

- Identify and troubleshoot performance issues such as slow page load times, high server response times, and large file sizes.

- Implement performance optimization techniques, such as minifying and compressing files, reducing image sizes, and disabling unnecessary plugins and scripts.

- Ensure that the website is running smoothly and efficiently by checking and fixing performance-related issues.

- Collaborate with our internal team to optimize the website's front-end and back-end to improve performance.


Requirements:

- Strong knowledge of WordPress and experience with performance optimization for WordPress websites.

- Knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and PHP.

- Experience with performance analysis tools such as Google PageSpeed Insights, GTmetrix, and Blog Vault.

- Ability to troubleshoot and solve performance-related issues.

- Good communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively with our internal team


The ideal candidate should have a passion for performance optimization and a desire to help improve the user experience of the website. If you have a proven track record of optimizing WordPress websites and have a deep understanding of website performance, we would like to hear from you!

data.client_name: Fix Wordpress Slow Loading and Timeouts
data.note:
I have a WordPress website that has a lot of accumulated content, about 20,000 posts over 13 years, and moderate to low traffic of about 30 people online at any given time. It has suddenly started loading extremely slowly, going from taking less than 5 seconds to taking as long as 25 seconds or more, with pages and functions often simply timing out.


I need someone to go in, identify the problem, and implement a solution that will allow the website to resume loading at a normal, fast speed.


These are the requirements for this project.


1. The website is very complex, with multiple plugins, and an integration to an app on a second server. No functions should be disrupted or broken during this process, and all functions will be tested afterwards.


2. When the problem is resolved I need to know what the issue was and how it was resolved, so that I can monitor for future problems.


3. We will need a few days after the solution is implemented to test and ensure that normal daily usage doesn’t cause the issue to return.


Please message me with any questions you may have. Thank you.
data.cover_letter:
Fix Wordpress Slow Loading and Timeouts


Hello there,

I will optimize the speed of your website and fix slow loading issues, I am a professional WordPress developer with 08 years of proven experience. Please send me a private message with your site URL because I want to review what is the issue actually slowing down the site.

Thanks!
